alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"One line of argument was that since these were all igneous rocks containing oxide minerals with iron partly in the ferric form, they must come from a fairly large body capable of internal melting, and furthermore one which is relatively oxidized. The 1976 NASA Viking landers supported the conjecture that the distinctive overall reddish color of Mars was caused by surface dust deposits that strongly resembled mixtures of clay and ferric oxides ..."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Martian Meteorites Do Not All Exhibit the Same Oxygen Isotope Ratio - Part 2
